meanings.definition: A machine with a rapidly rotating container that applies centrifugal force to its contents, typically to separate fluids of different densities or to remove moisture.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a centrifuge to separate the different liquids in the mixture.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician placed the blood sample in the centrifuge to separate the plasma from the red blood cells.
meanings.sent3: The centrifuge spun so fast that it made the liquids inside dizzy!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a centrifuge, swirling around and separating into distinct categories.
meanings.sent5: The centrifuge whirred loudly as it spun, creating a powerful force that separated the components.

meanings.definition: To subject to the action of a centrifuge.
meanings.sent1: The chemist will centrifuge the solution to extract the solid particles.
meanings.sent2: She carefully centrifuged the mixture to separate the sediment from the liquid.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to centrifuge the sauce to remove any lumps.
meanings.sent4: His emotions felt like they were being centrifuged, with the intense feelings rising to the surface.
meanings.sent5: The washing machine seemed to centrifuge the clothes with such force, they almost flew out of the drum.
